Title: Log Parsing: How Far Can ChatGPT Go?
Abstract: software logs play an essential role in ensuring the reliability and maintainability of large scale software systems as they are often the sole source of runtime information. log parsing which converts raw log messages into structured data is an important initial step towards downstream log analytics. in recent studies chatgpt the current cutting edge large language model  llm  has been widely applied to a wide range of software engineering tasks. however its performance in automated log parsing remains unclear. in this paper we evaluate chatgpt ability to undertake log parsing by addressing two research questions.  1  can chatgpt effectively parse logs?  2  how does chatgpt perform with different prompting methods? our results show that chatgpt can achieve promising results for log parsing with appropriate prompts especially with few shot prompting. based on our findings we outline several challenges and opportunities for chatgpt based log parsing.
